chav1961.purelib.fsys

Class FileSystemURLStreamHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.net.URLStreamHandler
      • chav1961.purelib.fsys.FileSystemURLStreamHandler

  • public class FileSystemURLStreamHandler
extends URLStreamHandler

    This class implements standard URLStreamHandler functionality to get access to the file systems thru it's URLs.

    URL format for the implementation is:

    FileSystemInterface.FILESYSTEM_URI_SCHEME:<filesystem_uri>#<object_inside>
    • filesystem_uri need be valid uri according to FileSystemFactory.createFileSystem(URI) requirements
    • object_inside need be valid file or directory name inside the file system

    When a file name is typed in object_inside, you can read or write it's content. When a directory name is typed in object_inside, you can only read it's content. The directory 'content' is a list of item single names inside it. Every name in the list is terminated with '\n' char.

    This class is not thread-safe.

    Since:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    FileSystemInterface, JUnit tests
